The feeling of specific materials such as leather, lycra, gortex, or latex, delivers a distinct jolt to the groin.  For others, it is the association of specific garments to their corresponding actions and lifestyles that is particularly exciting. For other’s still, the associated items themselves have a titillating appeal. Let’s explore this together.

![Sports Gear provides restriction and protection. It may also evoke nostalgic memories.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nHj2cDgFjqXMLgvkiQRI0.jpg?height=1448&width=1800)

Crucial in understanding Gear Fetishism, is the act of personal identity removal and subsequently the adoption of an alter ego. Helmets, hoods, masks, and other items that obscure identity, provide a two way path towards eroticism.

There is a decontextualization of the self, and a re-contextualization into a chosen identity. Beyond its sexual appeal, this concept and its relationship to the digital experience is endlessly fascinating to me.

*For the wearer* it allows a new found freedom. A release from the stressors or banality of daily life, allowing them to find relaxation or excitement in an alternate identity. Just as a superhero may feel empowered by wearing their uniform, a Gear Fetishist may feel an elevated sense of self by wearing their chosen Gear set. Mental hangups around sexuality can also be eased with Gear through depersonalization and dissociation. Gear allows the wearer to more deeply inhabit a feeling of a chosen identity which can lead to *intense* erotic satisfaction.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Tqbcg4r7u5MNrze6v2T5j.jpeg?height=2000&width=1618)

*For the observer,* a masked identity provides a thrilling sense of mystery and creates a blank slate for erotic projection. The mind is able to fantasize to its fullest ability when provided with a faceless being onto which they can project their desires. When the object of their desire is no longer a specific individual, with taxes to pay, emotions to process, stress to feel, banal obstacles to overcome -  they have become an idealized sexual being to interact with, like a sexy action figure. While in many cases outside of Gear Fetishism, this ‘sexual objectification’ is looked down upon, in the Gear community, it is celebrated distinctly because it is *chosen.*

These faceless beings allow for the embodiment of their [platonic ideal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Platonic_idealism#:\~:text=Platonic%20idealism%20usually%20refers%20to,may%20be%20most%20untree%2Dlike.) to enter the bedroom or ball field. An elevated, idealized form, existing as every version of itself that has ever occurred or will ever occur— its truest version of self.

No longer an individual, but an idea… a deity, or maybe a (sexy) daemon.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3Nd6ux8Cf2DBKu4Xf5ZZq.jpeg?height=2000&width=1618)

Wearers may also employe Gear to enhance their day to day identity, and not obfuscate it entirely. 

While sport & military uniforms can be easily traced to commonly held fetishes, other avenues of exploration such as scuba suites or motorcycle racing attire, require further examination. These examples, and many others, are associated with a physical action that in and of itself is erotic to participants.

As many Gear fetishists are also excited by bondage and restraint, an activity like scuba diving can be incredibly erotic. A combination of deep water pressure, cumbersome equipment and restricted breathing apparatuses, can provide a uniquely restrictive feeling, similar to bondage, but distinct in its accompanied feeling of weightlessness.

![Scuba fetishists embrace in the mid-western resort pool.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-AYFyeZXIVDMisu-pd_IK.jpg?height=1685&width=1400)

With [motocross apparel](https://www.ryder-gear.com/), there is a similar association between garment, identity and activity. The padded leather full-body suits, restrictive in nature, provide a base level of erotic pleasure for its bondage properties. The association of actually driving a motorcycle and its corresponding adrenaline rush also make for a compelling association. The thrill of racing along hairpins turns, the vibration and roar of the bike, it’s hard, blossoming steel components... In some cases, the sexual associations with motorcycles may extend to the bikes themselves. In this sense there is some crossover between Gear Fetishists and [Objectum Sexuality.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Object_sexuality) 

The identity associated with riding motorcycles, has long been fetishized culturally, as seen in movies like The Wild One, Easy Rider, Akira, various Bond films, The Matrix, Mad Max, and on and on. People that ride Motorcycles are cool, cocky, and confident…. and that’s hot!

![Gear Fetishism explores garment, identity and activity.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JYfY1BvVTi-o5XKWopbug.jpeg?height=1601&width=2000)

When aesthetics, sensory stimulation, biochemical association, and identity are all combined, a [gestlat](http://www.scholarpedia.org/article/Gestalt_principles) erotic stimulation occurs. In other words, the various elements come together to create a sensation that is *larger* *when combined*, than the sum total of those elements.

Exploration of the gestalt is a key tenant in my art practice. Like an alchemist I am always thinking about what new meaning can be found when combining various elements.

Gear Fetishishm should be explored through this gestalt lens. It is not a singular aspect of Gear that is exciting, but a combination of factors. Identity decontextualization and re-contextualization, sensory exploration, bodily restriction and associated activities come together to create mental stimulation that is larger than their direct sum.

Take the illustration below as an example. There is no triangle drawn here… only three partial circles, and yet our brain creates a triangle when these partial circles are arranged this way. The whole is greater than the sum of the parts.

![The gestalt principle, visualized](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rrPenCzu7au3_c3e3gPF4.jpeg?height=854&width=1000)

Imagine now that instead of three partial circles, we have ‘Identity’, ‘aesthetics’ and ‘sensation’ at the corners. These three elements come together to create a larger, alluring scenario that is exhilarating to participants. The brain gets to fill in the remaining “triangle” in a way that is pleasing.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Fe4Yk-S07y4Hl8dW497ob.jpeg?height=2000&width=1609)

My approach for a project like this, is a combination of observation and participation. I am not simply a voyeur, reporting coldly on an event, I am an active participant, exploring my own identify. I do not abide by strict photojournalistic standards that call for detachment and objectivity, as I do not consider myself strictly a photojournalist.

The removal of distinguishing human features and traditional gender markers combined with and the donning of a new, idealized form, becomes a rejection of the gender binary and compulsory heterosexuality. As we lose more and more control of our identity and our ability to act on our own free will, what will the human experience feel like? These are some of the questions I explore in this body of work and my wider art practice.

At times, the [sleep-sacks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sleepsack_(BDSM)) become body bags. When I made the images in 2017, I had just returned from a research trip, interviewing soldiers in state mandated military service. With mortality on my mind, these ‘body bags’ reminded me of the casualties of war, not just the loss of life, but the loss of spirit that can come with taking the life of another.

The people inside these sleep-sacks have chosen to be there, yet once inside, they are unable to free themselves. In May of 2020 I watched people in paper suits lay unmarked coffins into the red dirt of Hart Island. I would not go through these experiences, and be able to see a lawn strewn with body bags in the same way I did in years prior.

title: Using Mango CPI in from an Anchor Program
body:
So lately I’ve been tasked to integrate the Solana Program I’m working on with Mango. 
 I want to gather the knowledge and tidbits that I find valuable in case that can be of use.

 
 ______

 
 Mango is a decentralised exchange (DEX) that offer leverage and perpetuals.  
 Mango is also controlled by a DAO and to me it seems like a great example of decentralised governance! 

 
 And the most important, it’s a neat product I use since months, my main DEX. Good feature and UI, neat UX.

 
 _____

## Development Environment

In order to be productive, I want to iterate quickly.

Mango is currently accessible on `devnet` and `main-net` clusters, but my anchor workspace contains several projects, that I modify often, so I don’t feel like using `devnet`.

I want to be able to have my usual `anchor test` speed, not sure what happen behind the curtain but the deployments to `localnet` don’t event appear in the prompt, making it ideal for iterating fast.

In order to use Mango on `localnet` I found this neat option for `solana-test-validator` (the program running `localnet` coming with the Solana cli) :

`--clone <account>`  

It copies accounts from another cluster into the starting `localnet` instance, and note that once you run the `solana-local-validator` once, it create a `test-ledger` folder that store its state. So `--clone` only have effect when this `test-ledger` is not there, of if you use `--reset` to start fresh.

This is how I use it :

```
#!/bin/bash



# Reset then configure the local validator to mimic the mango accounts on devnet
solana-test-validator \
 --reset                                                `: # Reset the test-ledger` \
 --url https://mango.devnet.rpcpool.com                 `: # Cluster from which the below program will be cloned` \
 --clone Ec2enZyoC4nGpEfu2sUNAa2nUGJHWxoUWYSEJ2hNTWTA   `: # MANGO starts - devnet.2 cluster `\
 --clone 4skJ85cdxQAFVKbcGgfun8iZPL7BadVYXG3kGEGkufqA   `: # mangoProgramId `\
 --clone 6eadH6vSsEk5bPiXWPYRq5KRSjohfYd6Ug5HjGbxaWce \
 --clone DESVgJVGajEgKGXhb6XmqDHGz3VjdgP7rEVESBgxmroY   `: # serumProgramId`\
 --clone AvKzLiE8ezzp6kLVw49nq8drycE89NS1RQaBWjBNeUoF \
 --clone 8FRFC6MoGGkMFQwngccyu69VnYbzykGeez7ignHVAFSN   `: # USDC Mango test Token mint`\
 --clone 3UNBZ6o52WTWwjac2kPUb4FyodhU1vFkRJheu1Sh2TvU   `: # BTC Token mint`\
 --clone HovQMDrbAgAYPCmHVSrezcSmkMtXSSUsLDFANExrZh2J   `: # BTC oracle `\
 --clone BeEoyDq1v2DYJCoXDQAJKfmrsoRRvfmV856f2ijkXbtp   `: # BTC rootKey `\
 --clone 4X3nP921qyh6BKJSAohKGNCykSXahFFwg1LxtC993Fai   `: # BTC nodeKey `\
 --clone J83w4HKfqxwcq3BEMMkPFSppX3gqekLyLJBexebFVkix   `: # SOL oracle `\
 --clone 8GC81raaLjhTx3yedctxCJW46qdmmSRybH2s1eFYFFxT   `: # SOL rootKey `\
 --clone 7mYqCavd1K24fnL3oKTpX3YM66W5gfikmVHJWM3nrWKe   `: # SOL nodeKey `\
 --clone FHQtNjRHA9U5ahrH7mWky3gamouhesyQ5QvpeGKrTh2z   `: # BTC Perp market `\
 --clone F1Dcnq6F8NXR3gXADdsYqrXYBUUwoT7pfCtRuQWSyQFd   `: ## bidsKey `\
 --clone BFEBZsLYmEhj4quWDRKbyMKhW1Q9c7gu3LqsnipNGTVn   `: ## asksKey `\
 --clone Bu17U2YdBM9gRrqQ1zD6MpngQBb71RRAAn8dbxoFDSkU   `: ## eventsKey `\
 --clone 58vac8i9QXStG1hpaa4ouwE1X7ngeDjY9oY7R15hcbKJ   `: # SOL Perp market `\
 --clone 7HRgm8iXEDx2TmSETo3Lq9SXkF954HMVKNiq8t5sKvQS   `: ## bidsKey `\
 --clone 4oNxXQv1Rx3h7aNWjhTs3PWBoXdoPZjCaikSThV4yGb8   `: ## asksKey `\
 --clone CZ5MCRvkN38d5pnZDDEEyMiED3drgDUVpEUjkuJq31Kf   `: ## eventsKey `
#  > /dev/null 2>&1 & 
```

 
 The script above is what I run once to configure my `localnet`.

One neat thing you can do is also copying your wallets from the devnet in order to have the right tokens and balances :

```
--clone aca3VWxwBeu8FTZowJ9hfSKGzntjX68EXh1N9xpE1PC    `: # my wallet account (and its assoc token ones below, add yours too)` \
 --clone 8FRFC6MoGGkMFQwngccyu69VnYbzykGeez7ignHVAFSN   `: ## USDC` \
 --clone 9KBGW5bbfdLA4zKAXPETwjR5Ub7BR2Zh9gKHsPnrUkUg   `: ## BTC` \
```

 
 You can easily follow Mango tutorial to get Devnet tokens, then go trade these on the devnet Mango for other Sol, BTC and the like (That’s a good way to avoid the devnet sol airdrop limitation 🤫)

[https://docs.mango.markets/tutorials/how-to-receive-dev-net-tokens](https://docs.mango.markets/tutorials/how-to-receive-dev-net-tokens)

This allows me to send Mango instructions like `InitMangoAccount` successfully. 
  
 

## Anchor and CPI to Mango

Mango is not Anchor friendly.  
  
 I’ll update this article with the next part as I advance

title: The Visage as Vindication: an Exploration of Fantasy, Fetish, and Fatality
body:
Originally made in 2017, and edited in 2021, these photographs explore Gear Fetishism and its links to contemporary culture.

The images are made at a small convention in the mid-west, dedicated to the Gear Fetish community. Gear Fetishists find sexual satisfaction in functional garments, often associated with a specific identity, action, or occupation.

Sexual gratification from the wearing or worshipping of Gear is multi faceted. For some, the main attraction is sensory stimulation. The feeling of specific materials such as leather, lycra, gortex, or latex, delivers a distinct jolt to the groin.  For others, it is the association of specific garments to their corresponding actions and lifestyles that is particularly exciting. For other’s still, the associated items themselves have a titillating appeal. Let’s explore this together.

![Sports Gear provides restriction and protection. It may also evoke nostalgic memories.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nHj2cDgFjqXMLgvkiQRI0.jpg?height=1448&width=1800)

Crucial in understanding Gear Fetishism, is the act of personal identity removal and subsequently the adoption of an alter ego. Helmets, hoods, masks, and other items that obscure identity, provide a two way path towards eroticism.

There is a decontextualization of the self, and a re-contextualization into a chosen identity. Beyond its sexual appeal, this concept and its relationship to the digital experience is endlessly fascinating to me.

*For the wearer* it allows a new found freedom. A release from the stressors or banality of daily life, allowing them to find relaxation or excitement in an alternate identity. Just as a superhero may feel empowered by wearing their uniform, a Gear Fetishist may feel an elevated sense of self by wearing their chosen Gear set. Mental hangups around sexuality can also be eased with Gear through depersonalization and dissociation. Gear allows the wearer to more deeply inhabit a feeling of a chosen identity which can lead to *intense* erotic satisfaction.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Tqbcg4r7u5MNrze6v2T5j.jpeg?height=2000&width=1618)

*For the observer,* a masked identity provides a thrilling sense of mystery and creates a blank slate for erotic projection. The mind is able to fantasize to its fullest ability when provided with a faceless being onto which they can project their desires. When the object of their desire is no longer a specific individual, with taxes to pay, emotions to process, stress to feel, banal obstacles to overcome -  they have become an idealized sexual being to interact with, like a sexy action figure. While in many cases outside of Gear Fetishism, this ‘sexual objectification’ is looked down upon, in the Gear community, it is celebrated distinctly because it is *chosen.*

These faceless beings allow for the embodiment of their [platonic ideal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Platonic_idealism#:\~:text=Platonic%20idealism%20usually%20refers%20to,may%20be%20most%20untree%2Dlike.) to enter the bedroom or ball field. An elevated, idealized form, existing as every version of itself that has ever occurred or will ever occur— its truest version of self.

No longer an individual, but an idea… a deity, or maybe a (sexy) daemon.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3Nd6ux8Cf2DBKu4Xf5ZZq.jpeg?height=2000&width=1618)

Wearers may also employe Gear to enhance their day to day identity, and not obfuscate it entirely.

While sport & military uniforms can be easily traced to commonly held fetishes, other avenues of exploration such as scuba suites or motorcycle racing attire, require further examination. These examples, and many others, are associated with a physical action that in and of itself is erotic to participants.

As many Gear fetishists are also excited by bondage and restraint, an activity like scuba diving can be incredibly erotic. A combination of deep water pressure, cumbersome equipment and restricted breathing apparatuses, can provide a uniquely restrictive feeling, similar to bondage, but distinct in its accompanied feeling of weightlessness.

![Scuba fetishists embrace in the mid-western resort pool.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-AYFyeZXIVDMisu-pd_IK.jpg?height=1685&width=1400)

With [motocross apparel](https://www.ryder-gear.com/), there is a similar association between garment, identity and activity. The padded leather full-body suits, restrictive in nature, provide a base level of erotic pleasure for its bondage properties. The association of actually driving a motorcycle and its corresponding adrenaline rush also make for a compelling association. The thrill of racing along hairpins turns, the vibration and roar of the bike, it’s hard, blossoming steel components... In some cases, the sexual associations with motorcycles may extend to the bikes themselves. In this sense there is some crossover between Gear Fetishists and [Objectum Sexuality.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Object_sexuality)

The identity associated with riding motorcycles, has long been fetishized culturally, as seen in movies like The Wild One, Easy Rider, Akira, various Bond films, The Matrix, Mad Max, and on and on. People that ride Motorcycles are cool, cocky, and confident…. and that’s hot!

![Gear Fetishism explores garment, identity and activity.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JYfY1BvVTi-o5XKWopbug.jpeg?height=1601&width=2000)

When aesthetics, sensory stimulation, biochemical association, and identity are all combined, a [gestlat](http://www.scholarpedia.org/article/Gestalt_principles) erotic stimulation occurs. In other words, the various elements come together to create a sensation that is *larger* *when combined*, than the sum total of those elements.

Exploration of the gestalt is a key tenant in my art practice. Like an alchemist I am always thinking about what new meaning can be found when combining various elements.

Gear Fetishishm should be explored through this gestalt lens. It is not a singular aspect of Gear that is exciting, but a combination of factors. Identity decontextualization and re-contextualization, sensory exploration, bodily restriction and associated activities come together to create mental stimulation that is larger than their direct sum.

Take the illustration below as an example. There is no triangle drawn here… only three partial circles, and yet our brain creates a triangle when these partial circles are arranged this way. The whole is greater than the sum of the parts.

![The gestalt principle, visualized](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rrPenCzu7au3_c3e3gPF4.jpeg?height=854&width=1000)

Imagine now that instead of three partial circles, we have ‘Identity’, ‘aesthetics’ and ‘sensation’ at the corners. These three elements come together to create a larger, alluring scenario that is exhilarating to participants. The brain gets to fill in the remaining “triangle” in a way that is pleasing.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Fe4Yk-S07y4Hl8dW497ob.jpeg?height=2000&width=1609)

My approach for a project like this, is a combination of observation and participation. I am not simply a voyeur, reporting coldly on an event, I am an active participant, exploring my own identify. I do not abide by strict photojournalistic standards that call for detachment and objectivity, as I do not consider myself strictly a photojournalist.

### Beyond pure documentation, these photographs have abstract meanings that morph and change over time.

The removal of distinguishing human features and traditional gender markers combined with the donning of a new, idealized form, becomes a rejection of the gender binary and compulsory heterosexuality. This exploration of what life can be in a world free of the binary, is also an exploration [transhumanism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transhumanism) and [posthumanism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Posthumanism). As we enter a cyborg age, our lives dominated by algorithms and technology, what will our bodies become? As we lose more and more control of our identity and our ability to act on our own free will, what texture will the human experience take on? These are some of the questions I explore in this body of work and my wider art practice.

When I made the images in 2017, I had just returned from a research trip, interviewing soldiers in state mandated military service. With mortality on my mind, the black [sleep-sacks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sleepsack_(BDSM)) become body bags, and reminded me of the casualties of war, not just the loss of life, but the loss of spirit that can come with taking the life of another.

In the reality of the fetish convention, the people inside these sleep-sacks have chosen to be there, yet once inside, they are unable to free themselves. The folks caring for them — bringing them water, keeping them cool, helping them stay calm — reminds me nurses, caretakers, and activists – helping those that are strapped into a situation in which they can not escape unaided.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/puMQpT2V_PMNpwp0WhTEq.jpg?height=1446&width=1800)

As I approached these images once more in 2021, I could not help but associate these ‘body bag’ images with the immense loss of life we have experienced as a nation and as a planet. The victims of racist policing and incarceration, those lost to mass shootings, and the earth shattering loss of over 4.5 million people at the hands of the coronavirus and the subsequent failings of the government to control its spread and impact.

In May of 2020 I watched people in paper suits lay unmarked coffins into the red dirt of Hart Island. In June of 2020 I joined my fellows arm in arm on the streets as a nation erupted in anger at the news of yet another racially motivated execution. I saw friends beaten by police and assaulted by drivers. I saw queer teenagers kidnapped into unmarked police vans and dragged into the underbelly of the criminal “justice” system. title: The Visage as Vindication: an Exploration of Fantasy, Fetish, and Fatality
body:
Originally made in 2017, and edited in 2021, these photographs explore Gear Fetishism and its links to contemporary culture.

The images are made at a small convention in the mid-west, dedicated to the Gear Fetish community. Gear Fetishists find sexual satisfaction in functional garments, often associated with a specific identity, action, or occupation.

Sexual gratification from the wearing or worshipping of Gear is multi faceted. For some, the main attraction is sensory stimulation. The feeling of specific materials such as leather, lycra, gortex, or latex, delivers a distinct jolt to the groin.  For others, it is the association of specific garments to their corresponding actions and lifestyles that is particularly exciting. For other’s still, the associated items themselves have a titillating appeal. Let’s explore this together.

![Sports Gear provides restriction and protection. It may also evoke nostalgic memories.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nHj2cDgFjqXMLgvkiQRI0.jpg?height=1448&width=1800)

Crucial in understanding Gear Fetishism, is the act of personal identity removal and subsequently the adoption of an alter ego. Helmets, hoods, masks, and other items that obscure identity, provide a two way path towards eroticism.

There is a decontextualization of the self, and a re-contextualization into a chosen identity. Beyond its sexual appeal, this concept and its relationship to the digital experience is endlessly fascinating to me.

*For the wearer* it allows a new found freedom. A release from the stressors or banality of daily life, allowing them to find relaxation or excitement in an alternate identity. Just as a superhero may feel empowered by wearing their uniform, a Gear Fetishist may feel an elevated sense of self by wearing their chosen Gear set. Mental hangups around sexuality can also be eased with Gear through depersonalization and dissociation. Gear allows the wearer to more deeply inhabit a feeling of a chosen identity which can lead to *intense* erotic satisfaction.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Tqbcg4r7u5MNrze6v2T5j.jpeg?height=2000&width=1618)

*For the observer,* a masked identity provides a thrilling sense of mystery and creates a blank slate for erotic projection. The mind is able to fantasize to its fullest ability when provided with a faceless being onto which they can project their desires. When the object of their desire is no longer a specific individual, with taxes to pay, emotions to process, stress to feel, banal obstacles to overcome -  they have become an idealized sexual being to interact with, like a sexy action figure. While in many cases outside of Gear Fetishism, this ‘sexual objectification’ is looked down upon, in the Gear community, it is celebrated distinctly because it is *chosen.*

These faceless beings allow for the embodiment of their [platonic ideal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Platonic_idealism#:\~:text=Platonic%20idealism%20usually%20refers%20to,may%20be%20most%20untree%2Dlike.) to enter the bedroom or ball field. An elevated, idealized form, existing as every version of itself that has ever occurred or will ever occur— its truest version of self.

No longer an individual, but an idea… a deity, or maybe a (sexy) daemon.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3Nd6ux8Cf2DBKu4Xf5ZZq.jpeg?height=2000&width=1618)

Wearers may also employe Gear to enhance their day to day identity, and not obfuscate it entirely.

While sport & military uniforms can be easily traced to commonly held fetishes, other avenues of exploration such as scuba suites or motorcycle racing attire, require further examination. These examples, and many others, are associated with a physical action that in and of itself is erotic to participants.

As many Gear fetishists are also excited by bondage and restraint, an activity like scuba diving can be incredibly erotic. A combination of deep water pressure, cumbersome equipment and restricted breathing apparatuses, can provide a uniquely restrictive feeling, similar to bondage, but distinct in its accompanied feeling of weightlessness.

![Scuba fetishists embrace in the mid-western resort pool.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-AYFyeZXIVDMisu-pd_IK.jpg?height=1685&width=1400)

With [motocross apparel](https://www.ryder-gear.com/), there is a similar association between garment, identity and activity. The padded leather full-body suits, restrictive in nature, provide a base level of erotic pleasure for its bondage properties. The association of actually driving a motorcycle and its corresponding adrenaline rush also make for a compelling association. The thrill of racing along hairpins turns, the vibration and roar of the bike, it’s hard, blossoming steel components... In some cases, the sexual associations with motorcycles may extend to the bikes themselves. In this sense there is some crossover between Gear Fetishists and [Objectum Sexuality.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Object_sexuality)

The identity associated with riding motorcycles, has long been fetishized culturally, as seen in movies like The Wild One, Easy Rider, Akira, various Bond films, The Matrix, Mad Max, and on and on. People that ride Motorcycles are cool, cocky, and confident…. and that’s hot!

![Gear Fetishism explores garment, identity and activity.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JYfY1BvVTi-o5XKWopbug.jpeg?height=1601&width=2000)

When aesthetics, sensory stimulation, biochemical association, and identity are all combined, a [gestlat](http://www.scholarpedia.org/article/Gestalt_principles) erotic stimulation occurs. In other words, the various elements come together to create a sensation that is *larger* *when combined*, than the sum total of those elements.

Exploration of the gestalt is a key tenant in my art practice. Like an alchemist I am always thinking about what new meaning can be found when combining various elements.

Gear Fetishishm should be explored through this gestalt lens. It is not a singular aspect of Gear that is exciting, but a combination of factors. Identity decontextualization and re-contextualization, sensory exploration, bodily restriction and associated activities come together to create mental stimulation that is larger than their direct sum.

Take the illustration below as an example. There is no triangle drawn here… only three partial circles, and yet our brain creates a triangle when these partial circles are arranged this way. The whole is greater than the sum of the parts.

![The gestalt principle, visualized](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rrPenCzu7au3_c3e3gPF4.jpeg?height=854&width=1000)

Imagine now that instead of three partial circles, we have ‘Identity’, ‘aesthetics’ and ‘sensation’ at the corners. These three elements come together to create a larger, alluring scenario that is exhilarating to participants. The brain gets to fill in the remaining “triangle” in a way that is pleasing.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Fe4Yk-S07y4Hl8dW497ob.jpeg?height=2000&width=1609)

My approach for a project like this, is a combination of observation and participation. I am not simply a voyeur, reporting coldly on an event, I am an active participant, exploring my own identify. I do not abide by strict photojournalistic standards that call for detachment and objectivity, as I do not consider myself strictly a photojournalist.

The removal of distinguishing human features and traditional gender markers combined with the donning of a new, idealized form, becomes a rejection of the gender binary and compulsory heterosexuality. As we lose more and more control of our identity and our ability to act on our own free will, what texture will the human experience take on? These are some of the questions I explore in this body of work and my wider art practice.

When I made the images in 2017, I had just returned from a research trip, interviewing soldiers in state mandated military service. In the reality of the fetish convention, the people inside these sleep-sacks have chosen to be there, yet once inside, they are unable to free themselves. ![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/puMQpT2V_PMNpwp0WhTEq.jpg?height=1446&width=1800)

title: Using Mango CPI in from an Anchor Program
body:
So lately I’ve been tasked to integrate the Solana Program I’m working on with Mango.
I want to gather the knowledge and tidbits that I find valuable in case that can be of use.


______

Mango is a decentralised exchange (DEX) that offer leverage and perpetuals.Mango is also controlled by a DAO and to me it seems like a great example of decentralised governance!

And the most important, it’s a neat product I use since months, my main DEX. Good feature and UI, neat UX.


_____

## Localnet dev environment with --clone

In order to be productive, I want to iterate quickly.

Mango is currently accessible on `devnet` and `main-net` clusters, but my anchor workspace contains several projects, that I modify often, so I don’t feel like using `devnet`.

I want to be able to have my usual `anchor test` speed, not sure what happen behind the curtain but the deployments to `localnet` don’t event appear in the prompt, making it ideal for iterating fast.

In order to use Mango on `localnet` I found this neat option for `solana-test-validator` (the program running `localnet` coming with the Solana cli) :

`--clone <account>`  (credits to dvcrn#7961 on the Anchor discord)

It copies accounts from another cluster into the starting `localnet` instance, and note that once you run the `solana-local-validator` once, it create a `test-ledger` folder that store its state. So `--clone` only have effect when this `test-ledger` is not there, of if you use `--reset` to start fresh.

This is how I use it :

```
#!/bin/bash

# Reset then configure the local validator to mimic the mango accounts on devnet
solana-test-validator \
 --reset                                                `: # Reset the test-ledger` \
 --url https://mango.devnet.rpcpool.com                 `: # Cluster from which the below program will be cloned` \
 --clone Ec2enZyoC4nGpEfu2sUNAa2nUGJHWxoUWYSEJ2hNTWTA   `: # MANGO starts - devnet.2 cluster `\
 --clone 4skJ85cdxQAFVKbcGgfun8iZPL7BadVYXG3kGEGkufqA   `: # mangoProgramId `\
 --clone 6eadH6vSsEk5bPiXWPYRq5KRSjohfYd6Ug5HjGbxaWce \
 --clone DESVgJVGajEgKGXhb6XmqDHGz3VjdgP7rEVESBgxmroY   `: # serumProgramId`\
 --clone AvKzLiE8ezzp6kLVw49nq8drycE89NS1RQaBWjBNeUoF \
 --clone 8FRFC6MoGGkMFQwngccyu69VnYbzykGeez7ignHVAFSN   `: # USDC Mango test Token mint`\
 --clone 3UNBZ6o52WTWwjac2kPUb4FyodhU1vFkRJheu1Sh2TvU   `: # BTC Token mint`\
 --clone HovQMDrbAgAYPCmHVSrezcSmkMtXSSUsLDFANExrZh2J   `: # BTC oracle `\
 --clone BeEoyDq1v2DYJCoXDQAJKfmrsoRRvfmV856f2ijkXbtp   `: # BTC rootKey `\
 --clone 4X3nP921qyh6BKJSAohKGNCykSXahFFwg1LxtC993Fai   `: # BTC nodeKey `\
 --clone J83w4HKfqxwcq3BEMMkPFSppX3gqekLyLJBexebFVkix   `: # SOL oracle `\
 --clone 8GC81raaLjhTx3yedctxCJW46qdmmSRybH2s1eFYFFxT   `: # SOL rootKey `\
 --clone 7mYqCavd1K24fnL3oKTpX3YM66W5gfikmVHJWM3nrWKe   `: # SOL nodeKey `\
 --clone FHQtNjRHA9U5ahrH7mWky3gamouhesyQ5QvpeGKrTh2z   `: # BTC Perp market `\
 --clone F1Dcnq6F8NXR3gXADdsYqrXYBUUwoT7pfCtRuQWSyQFd   `: ## bidsKey `\
 --clone BFEBZsLYmEhj4quWDRKbyMKhW1Q9c7gu3LqsnipNGTVn   `: ## asksKey `\
 --clone Bu17U2YdBM9gRrqQ1zD6MpngQBb71RRAAn8dbxoFDSkU   `: ## eventsKey `\
 --clone 58vac8i9QXStG1hpaa4ouwE1X7ngeDjY9oY7R15hcbKJ   `: # SOL Perp market `\
 --clone 7HRgm8iXEDx2TmSETo3Lq9SXkF954HMVKNiq8t5sKvQS   `: ## bidsKey `\
 --clone 4oNxXQv1Rx3h7aNWjhTs3PWBoXdoPZjCaikSThV4yGb8   `: ## asksKey `\
 --clone CZ5MCRvkN38d5pnZDDEEyMiED3drgDUVpEUjkuJq31Kf   `: ## eventsKey `
#  > /dev/null 2>&1 & 
```

I run that script once to configure my `localnet`, or to reset it.

You can then start you `solana-local-validator` the usual way, or run the above script each time if you want to have a deterministic environment.

You then call `anchor test --skip-local-validator` to ran your test suit against it (at first I though Anchor would pick up the local `test-ledger` but it doesn’t)

All the accounts come from the mango `ids.rs`

[https://github.com/blockworks-foundation/mango-client-v3/blob/main/src/ids.json](https://github.com/blockworks-foundation/mango-client-v3/blob/main/src/ids.json)


______

One neat additional thing you can do, is to also copy your wallets from the devnet in order to have the right tokens and balances :

```
--clone aca3VWxwBeu8FTZowJ9hfSKGzntjX68EXh1N9xpE1PC    `: # my wallet account (and its assoc token ones below, add yours too)` \
 --clone 8FRFC6MoGGkMFQwngccyu69VnYbzykGeez7ignHVAFSN   `: ## USDC` \
 --clone 9KBGW5bbfdLA4zKAXPETwjR5Ub7BR2Zh9gKHsPnrUkUg   `: ## BTC` \
```

You can easily follow Mango tutorial to get Devnet tokens, then go trade these on the devnet Mango for other Sol, BTC and the like (That’s a good way to avoid the devnet sol airdrop limitation 🤫)

[https://docs.mango.markets/tutorials/how-to-receive-dev-net-tokens](https://docs.mango.markets/tutorials/how-to-receive-dev-net-tokens)

This allows me to send Mango instructions like `InitMangoAccount` successfully.

One thing that I loose using `anchor test --skip-local-validator` compared to just running `anchor test` is that the deployment does prompt now, not as fast. Will look into that later to understand what’s the diff.


__________

## Anchor and CPI to Mango

Mango is not Anchor friendly.

I’ll update this article with the next part as I advance

body: Everything is a race nowadays, or everything is a game. Decentralized such that the wisdom of the mob can skim the cream from the pot or the best can be recognized as justifiably such. But what if mirror needed something or someone that simply checked in every day, even when the merit or form wasn’t the most compelling. That is what I hope to do with this project. title: 做到这一点，任何庄家都拿你没辙！
body:
2021年8月18日，一夜之间，跌了！整个数字货币加密市场整体下跌4.3%，ETH 在 24 小时内最低达到 3007 美元，接近跌破 3000 美元。 4小时内，全网清算近2亿美元。很多人亏钱了，说又要开始进入：无效上班阶段，呵呵，这所谓的无效上班，就是上一天班还没亏得多！所以看到很多人都开始讨论一个问题：这么跌一下，是方向变了，还是暂时回调，我们该怎么办？

今天我不正面回答这个问题，如果想看具体问题答案的可以去我微博上看，有对应的博文。咱们短视频里面，主要讲干货、讲圈里的故事为主！前两天，又有个微博的朋友给我发私信讲述了他的悲惨遭遇：梭哈了一个土狗项目，结果不到十天被脚斩，注意啊，不是腰斩，是脚斩，几十万血本无归。 对于这种每天都在上演的杯具，我想说的是，尽管生存环境险象环生，但作为散户也绝不是无能为力、任由庄家宰割。今天这个视频，我会教大家如何逃出庄家的魔掌，如果这条视频能减少几个未来可能会出现的杯具，就算是值了。

首先，我们要明确一点，在交易环节，所有人都是平等的。不管是散户、大户还是庄家，都是买进卖出，全凭自愿。唯一区别是，庄家手上有大量筹码和资金，所以能够操控盘面，而散户无法主导盘面，只能夹缝中求生存。那么，问题来了。面对劣势，散户如何才能赚到钱？

或许你从未想过这个问题，或许你也在看着K线感慨：TMD暴涨的时候老子不在，暴跌的时候老子却赶上了，甚至很多散户说，我他娘的一买就跌，一卖就涨，我这点资金是不是被主力盯上了？嗯，庄家就盯着你荷包里这几块钱在呢！

来，话题回来。为什么会暴涨？是因为庄家嫌接盘的资金不够多，所以要继续制造盘面繁荣，继续制造财富效应，目的是继续吸引散户的资金上车。为什么会暴跌？因为上车资金达到预期，新增资金衰竭，存量获利资金开始出逃，于是，收割模式开启。

为什么你一卖就暴涨？因为庄家要拉升制造赚钱效应，肯定不可能给你抬轿吧？所以一定是等散户的筹码在底部出清了才会开始拉升，他会制造各种K线让你不堪折磨、直到割肉出局，把筹码低价交给他。你不卖它不涨，你一卖他就涨，你不买他就不停涨，你终于按捺不住、追高买入就被深套。这些都很正常，并不是你以为的运气差。只是对于庄家的世界你一无所知，才会一直觉得这是运气差的问题。所以多年来我一直在说，散户亏钱绝不是运气差，而是必然。侥幸赚钱才真的是运气好到爆。

那么，现在你能有所感悟了吗？

当你想清楚了这些问题之后，如果你还愿意参与这场游戏的话，那么，你唯一的胜算在于：在庄家收割之前，能够在暴涨途中出逃。一局游戏，庄家永远只能收割大多数，总会有少数幸运儿胜出。这和押单双一样，在庄家能操控色子的情况下，100万押了单，200万押了双，开奖结果必然是单。押单的少数就成了幸运儿。但是只要你不停地玩下去，你总会沦为“可怜的大多数”。

当你明白了这些，再去看那些正在暴涨的币的时候，你会不会是另外一种心境？会不会隐约明白了庄家的意图？涨一倍，咦，怎么进来的资金还不多？TMD这届散户觉悟不高嘛！那再涨一倍！让你浮盈好了，你浮盈了就会继续追加投资嘛！你就会鼓动周围人来追高嘛！

只要你不跑路，就一直涨涨涨，让你爽爽爽！

一直涨到所有人觉得这只币就是未来的超级大黑马，砸锅卖铁、卖血卖肾也得上车！下车？不存在的，打死都不能下车！

那么，庄家的目的就达到了。只等最后锤落鼓停，庄家收网，花落谁家谁傻逼。。。 

搜迪斯内！！！

好吧，刚理清点头绪，我又要浇一盆冰水了。

尽管你明白了庄家的套路，但是真没什么卵用，因为你没办法知道整个盘面资金的进出变化，所以你永远不知道庄家会何时落锤收网。

散户如果享受过浮盈，最后被收割，大概很大程度上还会自责，怪自己没有在赚的时候及时出局，输给庄家虽有不甘，但心服口服。

好了，进入正题。庄家（恶庄暂且就排除在外吧）最怕散户的是哪一点？作为过来人，我负责任地告诉你：在底部，最怕你不看盘。在顶部，最怕你提前跑。

在底部，庄家会做出各种花样，无非是让你看盘后产生恐惧、直到绝望，然后放弃筹码，他才好拉升做盘。这时候如果你不看盘的话，他拿你一点办法都没有。开头我说了，交易环节，人人平等，他并不能拿把刀架在你脖子上威胁你交出筹码。

如果你看了他的各种表演之后自己乖乖交出筹码，后来错过行情，又能怪谁呢？

反之，如果你不看盘或者看盘后无动于衷，散户手上的低价筹码太多，庄家是不会轻易拉升的。这只票就成了废票。

 当然，这一点并不是最重要的，毕竟就算你选择错误，交出了筹码，也无非是错过一波行情而已。市场上最不缺的就是机会。接下来的第二点，才是我今天真正想说的，毫不夸张的讲，接下来的内容，字字珠玑，请一定牢记在心，多年之后你一定会感谢我。

你永远得明白一个事情，二级市场最重要的，不是什么时候进场，而是知道什么时候该离场。

如果你有幸在暴涨中持币，在顶部开始收割之时，庄家也会做出各种花样，让你继续持有，高明的庄家都擅长这一套，玩弄人心。一旦收割开启，从浮盈到持平，从持平到巨亏，就由不得你了。

假如你在收割之初就能跑掉，那对于庄家来说绝逼是一个灾难。

不仅能赚走他精心为你准备的诱饵，而且对他的操盘技术也是一种羞辱。可谓是：杀人诛心。尤其是你的出逃并不是出于运气，而是主动为之。

这种技能，大概是所有散户梦寐以求的吧！我称之为：出局技术。

在你账户还在盈利的时候出局，叫止盈，在你账户出现亏损的时候出局，叫止损。 就算出现极端情况，哪怕你是在山尖尖上买的币，如果你能及时止损，也大概率能成功出逃。

即便你不懂技术分析、不知道什么时候该出局，也无妨，在一开始，设置两个关键位置点的止损即可。如此一来，当你做错、陷入庄家精心布置的陷阱之时，却能以极小的代价爬出陷阱、逃出生天，庄家又能拿你有什么办法？！ 

这正是我一再强调的，做错并不可怕，可怕的是你不认错，抱着侥幸心理任凭错误扩大吞噬一切。切记：不管庄家如何卖弄技术骗你上当，你只要盯住自己的账户，控制亏损就行了。

就像我上大学时期的院足球队，有个铁后卫，很少有前锋能过掉他，他只保证一点：老子只盯球，不看你浑身的假动作，人想过请自便，球要过不答应。是谓：人过球不过。

其实，做交易也是一样的道理！

用一句简单粗暴的话来讲，只要你的每笔交易都能把止损放在第一位，把亏损控制在很小的范围，你就超过了99%的散户。

那么，这世上任何庄家都会拿你没辙，哪怕是币市中那些凶猛残暴的恶庄！

body:
Originally made in 2017, and edited in 2021, these photographs explore Gear Fetishism and its links to contemporary culture.

The images are made at a small convention in the mid-west, dedicated to the Gear Fetish community. Gear Fetishists find sexual satisfaction in functional garments, often associated with a specific identity, action, or occupation.

Sexual gratification from the wearing or worshipping of Gear is multi faceted. For some, the main attraction is sensory stimulation. The feeling of specific materials such as leather, lycra, gortex, or latex, delivers a distinct jolt to the groin.  For others, it is the association of specific garments to their corresponding actions and lifestyles that is particularly exciting. For other’s still, the associated items themselves have a titillating appeal. Let’s explore this together.

![Sports Gear provides restriction and protection. It may also evoke nostalgic memories.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nHj2cDgFjqXMLgvkiQRI0.jpg?height=1448&width=1800)

Crucial in understanding Gear Fetishism, is the act of personal identity removal and subsequently the adoption of an alter ego. Helmets, hoods, masks, and other items that obscure identity, provide a two way path towards eroticism.

There is a decontextualization of the self, and a re-contextualization into a chosen identity. Beyond its sexual appeal, this concept and its relationship to the digital experience is endlessly fascinating to me.

*For the wearer* it allows a new found freedom. A release from the stressors or banality of daily life, allowing them to find relaxation or excitement in an alternate identity. Just as a superhero may feel empowered by wearing their uniform, a Gear Fetishist may feel an elevated sense of self by wearing their chosen Gear set. Mental hangups around sexuality can also be eased with Gear through depersonalization and dissociation. Gear allows the wearer to more deeply inhabit a feeling of a chosen identity which can lead to *intense* erotic satisfaction.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Tqbcg4r7u5MNrze6v2T5j.jpeg?height=2000&width=1618)

*For the observer,* a masked identity provides a thrilling sense of mystery and creates a blank slate for erotic projection. The mind is able to fantasize to its fullest ability when provided with a faceless being onto which they can project their desires. When the object of their desire is no longer a specific individual, with taxes to pay, emotions to process, stress to feel, banal obstacles to overcome -  they have become an idealized sexual being to interact with, like a sexy action figure. While in many cases outside of Gear Fetishism, this ‘sexual objectification’ is looked down upon, in the Gear community, it is celebrated distinctly because it is *chosen.*

These faceless beings allow for the embodiment of their [platonic ideal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Platonic_idealism#:\~:text=Platonic%20idealism%20usually%20refers%20to,may%20be%20most%20untree%2Dlike.) to enter the bedroom or ball field. An elevated, idealized form, existing as every version of itself that has ever occurred or will ever occur— its truest version of self.

No longer an individual, but an idea… a deity, or maybe a (sexy) daemon.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3Nd6ux8Cf2DBKu4Xf5ZZq.jpeg?height=2000&width=1618)

Wearers may also employe Gear to enhance their day to day identity, and not obfuscate it entirely.

While sport & military uniforms can be easily traced to commonly held fetishes, other avenues of exploration such as scuba suites or motorcycle racing attire, require further examination. These examples, and many others, are associated with a physical action that in and of itself is erotic to participants.

As many Gear fetishists are also excited by bondage and restraint, an activity like scuba diving can be incredibly erotic. A combination of deep water pressure, cumbersome equipment and restricted breathing apparatuses, can provide a uniquely restrictive feeling, similar to bondage, but distinct in its accompanied feeling of weightlessness.

![Scuba fetishists embrace in the mid-western resort pool.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-AYFyeZXIVDMisu-pd_IK.jpg?height=1685&width=1400)

With [motocross apparel](https://www.ryder-gear.com/), there is a similar association between garment, identity and activity. The padded leather full-body suits, restrictive in nature, provide a base level of erotic pleasure for its bondage properties. The association of actually driving a motorcycle and its corresponding adrenaline rush also make for a compelling association. The thrill of racing along hairpins turns, the vibration and roar of the bike, it’s hard, blossoming steel components... In some cases, the sexual associations with motorcycles may extend to the bikes themselves. In this sense there is some crossover between Gear Fetishists and [Objectum Sexuality.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Object_sexuality)

The identity associated with riding motorcycles, has long been fetishized culturally, as seen in movies like The Wild One, Easy Rider, Akira, various Bond films, The Matrix, Mad Max, and on and on. People that ride Motorcycles are cool, cocky, and confident…. and that’s hot!

![Gear Fetishism explores garment, identity and activity.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JYfY1BvVTi-o5XKWopbug.jpeg?height=1601&width=2000)

When aesthetics, sensory stimulation, biochemical association, and identity are all combined, a [gestlat](http://www.scholarpedia.org/article/Gestalt_principles) erotic stimulation occurs. In other words, the various elements come together to create a sensation that is *larger* *when combined*, than the sum total of those elements.

Exploration of the gestalt is a key tenant in my art practice. Like an alchemist I am always thinking about what new meaning can be found when combining various elements.

Gear Fetishishm should be explored through this gestalt lens. It is not a singular aspect of Gear that is exciting, but a combination of factors. Identity decontextualization and re-contextualization, sensory exploration, bodily restriction and associated activities come together to create mental stimulation that is larger than their direct sum.

Take the illustration below as an example. There is no triangle drawn here… only three partial circles, and yet our brain creates a triangle when these partial circles are arranged this way. The whole is greater than the sum of the parts.

![The gestalt principle, visualized](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rrPenCzu7au3_c3e3gPF4.jpeg?height=854&width=1000)

Imagine now that instead of three partial circles, we have ‘Identity’, ‘aesthetics’ and ‘sensation’ at the corners. These three elements come together to create a larger, alluring scenario that is exhilarating to participants. The brain gets to fill in the remaining “triangle” in a way that is pleasing.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Fe4Yk-S07y4Hl8dW497ob.jpeg?height=2000&width=1609)

My approach for a project like this, is a combination of observation and participation. I am not simply a voyeur, reporting coldly on an event, I am an active participant, exploring my own identify. I do not abide by strict photojournalistic standards that call for detachment and objectivity, as I do not consider myself strictly a photojournalist.

### Beyond pure documentation, these photographs have abstract meanings that morph and change over time.

The removal of distinguishing human features and traditional gender markers combined with the donning of a new, idealized form, becomes a rejection of the gender binary and compulsory heterosexuality. This exploration of what life can be in a world free of the binary, is also an exploration [transhumanism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transhumanism) and [posthumanism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Posthumanism). As we enter a cyborg age, our lives dominated by algorithms and technology, what will our bodies become? As we lose more and more control of our identity and our ability to act on our own free will, what texture will the human experience take on? These are some of the questions I explore in this body of work and my wider art practice.

When I made the images in 2017, I had just returned from a research trip, interviewing soldiers in state mandated military service. With mortality on my mind, the black [sleep-sacks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sleepsack_(BDSM)) become body bags, and reminded me of the casualties of war, not just the loss of life, but the loss of spirit that can come with taking the life of another.

In the reality of the fetish convention, the people inside these sleep-sacks have chosen to be there, yet once inside, they are unable to free themselves. The folks caring for them — bringing them water, keeping them cool, helping them stay calm — reminds me nurses, caretakers, and activists – helping those that are strapped into a situation in which they can not escape unaided.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/puMQpT2V_PMNpwp0WhTEq.jpg?height=1446&width=1800)

As I approached these images once more in 2021, I could not help but associate these ‘body bag’ images with the immense loss of life we have experienced as a nation and as a planet. The victims of racist policing and incarceration, those lost to mass shootings, and the earth shattering loss of over 4.5 million people at the hands of the coronavirus and the subsequent failings of the government to control its spread and impact.

In May of 2020 I watched people in paper suits lay unmarked coffins into the red dirt of Hart Island. In June of 2020 I joined my fellows arm in arm on the streets as a nation erupted in anger at the news of yet another racially motivated execution. I saw friends beaten by police and assaulted by drivers. I saw queer teenagers kidnapped into unmarked police vans and dragged into the underbelly of the criminal “justice” system. I saw medics cradle limp bodies and flush out eyes with milk and water. I could not go through these experiences, and be able to see a lawn strewn with body bags in the same way I did in years prior.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/AKlnt_ScDPOYhhImAiYuI.jpg?height=1350&width=1800)

This association is very troubling to me as a maker. The individuals in these photographs have elected to be in there by way of sexual gratification. I hold the fetish community in extremely high regard and I always want to celebrate their commitment to authenticity and sexual expression. The documentarian in me never wants to misrepresent the actions that I am photographing, but the abstract artist in me can not help but impregnate the images with meaning.

These photographs are a celebration of the fetish community, people bold enough to live authentically, even when it goes against the grain of polite society. It is *also* an exploration of mortality, care, intimacy and history.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mQSgm2Y5DRQfEKIeHhpiP.jpeg?height=1594&width=2000)

Just as we explored the gestalt principal earlier in this document, I encourage you now to deploy that idea when considering the implications of my artist statement and the work presented in this collection.

The images do not have a fixed identity, they do not represent one thing, they represent many things simultaneously, on a spectrum with edges determined by the viewer’s past experiences. The work is non-binary in and of itself. It exists in a way that is undulating and ever changing, all while rejecting the compulsory roles that culture would have it adopt. For me, this rejection of a singular definition, what I’m calling “nonbinary maximalism” is the essence of queerness, and an acknowledgment that the world and the bodies we inhabit contain multitudes.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/eIvyZ1JXE4m1Ob7OeLdoS.jpeg?height=1714&width=2000)

For an expanded history of the gear fetish scene and its roots on the internet, please [see this forum post](https://gearfetishx.com/forum/groups/topic/GearFetish-com-Archive.htm#10).

To see more photos by the author, visit [zak.photos](https://zak.photos); art displayed on zak.photos is available for private NFT sale upon request.

For inquiries or feedback, please contact [@Zak_krevitt](https://twitter.com/zak_krevitt) on Twitter.

One of my first ever NFTs was an excerpt from this same series. This is part of the reason I have decided to mint the rest of the series as my first collection. I consider this piece GearHead #0. For me it achieves the core of what the series can be. A juxtaposition of steel and flowers, rugged masculinity and tender femininity.

The images are made at a small convention in the mid-west, dedicated to the Gear Fetish community. Gear Fetishists find sexual satisfaction in functional garments, often associated with a specific identity, action, or occupation.

The feeling of specific materials such as leather, lycra, gortex, or latex, delivers a distinct jolt to the groin. *For the wearer* it allows a new found freedom. A release from the stressors or banality of daily life, allowing them to find relaxation or excitement in an alternate identity. Just as a superhero may feel empowered by wearing their uniform, a Gear Fetishist may feel an elevated sense of self by wearing their chosen Gear set. Mental hangups around sexuality can also be eased with Gear through depersonalization and dissociation. Gear allows the wearer to more deeply inhabit a feeling of a chosen identity which can lead to *intense* erotic satisfaction.

title: How to Earn VKR
Mango integration, localnet testing and Anchor CPI to non Anchor programs
body:
So lately I’ve been tasked to integrate the Solana Program I’m working on with Mango.
I want to gather the knowledge and tidbits that I find valuable in case that can be of use. 
  
 *Sky Burial #2 by Wayne Haag, space derelicts are cool*


______

Mango is a decentralised exchange (DEX) that offer leverage and perpetuals.Mango is also controlled by a DAO and to me it seems like a great example of decentralised governance!

And the most important, it’s a neat product I use since months, my main DEX. Good feature and UI, neat UX.


_____

## Localnet dev environment with --clone

In order to be productive, I want to iterate quickly.

Mango is currently accessible on `devnet` and `main-net` clusters, but my anchor workspace contains several projects, that I modify often, so I don’t feel like using `devnet`.

I want to be able to have my usual `anchor test` speed, not sure what happen behind the curtain but the deployments to `localnet` don’t event appear in the prompt, making it ideal for iterating fast.

In order to use Mango on `localnet` I found this neat option for `solana-test-validator` (the program running `localnet` coming with the Solana cli) :

`--clone <account>`  (credits to dvcrn#7961 on the Anchor discord)

It copies accounts from another cluster into the starting `localnet` instance, and note that once you run the `solana-local-validator` once, it create a `test-ledger` folder that store its state. So `--clone` only have effect when this `test-ledger` is not there, of if you use `--reset` to start fresh.

This is how I use it :

```
#!/bin/bash

# Reset then configure the local validator to mimic the mango accounts on devnet
solana-test-validator \
 --reset                                                `: # Reset the test-ledger` \
 --url https://mango.devnet.rpcpool.com                 `: # Cluster from which the below program will be cloned` \
 --clone Ec2enZyoC4nGpEfu2sUNAa2nUGJHWxoUWYSEJ2hNTWTA   `: # MANGO starts - devnet.2 cluster `\
 --clone 4skJ85cdxQAFVKbcGgfun8iZPL7BadVYXG3kGEGkufqA   `: # mangoProgramId `\
 --clone 6eadH6vSsEk5bPiXWPYRq5KRSjohfYd6Ug5HjGbxaWce \
 --clone DESVgJVGajEgKGXhb6XmqDHGz3VjdgP7rEVESBgxmroY   `: # serumProgramId`\
 --clone AvKzLiE8ezzp6kLVw49nq8drycE89NS1RQaBWjBNeUoF \
 --clone 8FRFC6MoGGkMFQwngccyu69VnYbzykGeez7ignHVAFSN   `: # USDC Mango test Token mint`\
 --clone 3UNBZ6o52WTWwjac2kPUb4FyodhU1vFkRJheu1Sh2TvU   `: # BTC Token mint`\
 --clone HovQMDrbAgAYPCmHVSrezcSmkMtXSSUsLDFANExrZh2J   `: # BTC oracle `\
 --clone BeEoyDq1v2DYJCoXDQAJKfmrsoRRvfmV856f2ijkXbtp   `: # BTC rootKey `\
 --clone 4X3nP921qyh6BKJSAohKGNCykSXahFFwg1LxtC993Fai   `: # BTC nodeKey `\
 --clone J83w4HKfqxwcq3BEMMkPFSppX3gqekLyLJBexebFVkix   `: # SOL oracle `\
 --clone 8GC81raaLjhTx3yedctxCJW46qdmmSRybH2s1eFYFFxT   `: # SOL rootKey `\
 --clone 7mYqCavd1K24fnL3oKTpX3YM66W5gfikmVHJWM3nrWKe   `: # SOL nodeKey `\
 --clone FHQtNjRHA9U5ahrH7mWky3gamouhesyQ5QvpeGKrTh2z   `: # BTC Perp market `\
 --clone F1Dcnq6F8NXR3gXADdsYqrXYBUUwoT7pfCtRuQWSyQFd   `: ## bidsKey `\
 --clone BFEBZsLYmEhj4quWDRKbyMKhW1Q9c7gu3LqsnipNGTVn   `: ## asksKey `\
 --clone Bu17U2YdBM9gRrqQ1zD6MpngQBb71RRAAn8dbxoFDSkU   `: ## eventsKey `\
 --clone 58vac8i9QXStG1hpaa4ouwE1X7ngeDjY9oY7R15hcbKJ   `: # SOL Perp market `\
 --clone 7HRgm8iXEDx2TmSETo3Lq9SXkF954HMVKNiq8t5sKvQS   `: ## bidsKey `\
 --clone 4oNxXQv1Rx3h7aNWjhTs3PWBoXdoPZjCaikSThV4yGb8   `: ## asksKey `\
 --clone CZ5MCRvkN38d5pnZDDEEyMiED3drgDUVpEUjkuJq31Kf   `: ## eventsKey `
#  > /dev/null 2>&1 & 
```

I run that script once to configure my `localnet`, or to reset it.

You can then start you `solana-local-validator` the usual way, or run the above script each time if you want to have a deterministic environment.

You then call `anchor test --skip-local-validator` to ran your test suit against it (at first I though Anchor would pick up the local `test-ledger` but it doesn’t)

All the accounts come from the mango `ids.rs`

[https://github.com/blockworks-foundation/mango-client-v3/blob/main/src/ids.json](https://github.com/blockworks-foundation/mango-client-v3/blob/main/src/ids.json)


______

One neat additional thing you can do, is to also copy your wallets from the devnet in order to have the right tokens and balances :

```
--clone aca3VWxwBeu8FTZowJ9hfSKGzntjX68EXh1N9xpE1PC    `: # my wallet account (and its assoc token ones below, add yours too)` \
 --clone 8FRFC6MoGGkMFQwngccyu69VnYbzykGeez7ignHVAFSN   `: ## USDC` \
 --clone 9KBGW5bbfdLA4zKAXPETwjR5Ub7BR2Zh9gKHsPnrUkUg   `: ## BTC` \
```

You can easily follow Mango tutorial to get Devnet tokens, then go trade these on the devnet Mango for other Sol, BTC and the like (That’s a good way to avoid the devnet sol airdrop limitation 🤫)

[https://docs.mango.markets/tutorials/how-to-receive-dev-net-tokens](https://docs.mango.markets/tutorials/how-to-receive-dev-net-tokens)

This allows me to send Mango instructions like `InitMangoAccount` successfully.

One thing that I loose using `anchor test --skip-local-validator` compared to just running `anchor test` is that the deployment does prompt now, not as fast. Will look into that later to understand what’s the diff.


__________

## Anchor and CPI to Mango

Mango is not Anchor friendly, seems normal as the project is big and complex, and has been started from before Anchor. Also they probably don’t want to rely on a WIP framework.

Most of the “issues” here, are not really issues… Just sugar and QoL stuff, subjective. 
  
 First issues is that you cannot use the idiomatic Anchor stuff like `Program<‘info, Mango>` as mango did not have a declare_id required by Anchor. 
  
 Did a smol PR about it : 

[https://github.com/blockworks-foundation/mango-v3/pull/67](https://github.com/blockworks-foundation/mango-v3/pull/67)

_____

### Creating and initialising the MangoAccount

The next thing is that the `mango::state::MangoAccount` has a span of 28912 bytes if I’m not mistaken, preventing you to use the Anchor IDL account creation :

        bump,

        space = MANGO_ACCOUNT_SPAN, // 28912

```

 
 Results in this error : 
 `Account data size realloc limited to 10240 in inner instructions`

So I fall back on the associated instruction init as follows :

```

#[account(mut, signer)] // CPI initialization
pub mango_account: AccountInfo<'info>,
